title: Obligatorio si eres fan de la saga
review_body: Si te manejas con el inglés y te gusta el lore de Destiny es una compra obligatoria. El libro parece muchísimo más caro que lo que cuesta, con la portada de piel acolchada y las páginas satinadas de buen gramaje. Incluye ilustraciones y extractos de la historia de Destiny con detalles que aportan profundidad a eventos que están pasando ahora mismo en el juego (en este volumen se nombran detalles sobre la oscuridad y que habrá guardianes que puedan darle uso, etc.). Si solo te gusta el juego por los tiros, igual te parece una tontería, pero si te interesa la historia y todo el background que construye el universo Destiny es una compra obligatoria. Ideal para entender un poco mejor los videos de "My name is Byf".

title: It's basically a printed version of Book of Sorrows with minimal illustrations
review_body: I compare "game" printed lorebooks to the following standards: Does it stand up as something separate from the game (good writing, illustrations)? Does it feel like a piece of the game made material? Is it well made?One of my favorite books as a kid was some lore book from a fantasy gaming book series, and I had no idea till decades later when I stumbled across the book series in a library give-away bin. More recent game-lore books I've loved are "Book of Cain" (Diablo 3) and "New York Survival Guide" (The Division).The easy route is to take in-game lore and just dump it in a printed book. The better approach is to recontextualize the story, setting and lore into something new and complementary.I was SUPER excited to see Destiny lore books! Unfortunately, Bungie took the aforementioned easy route with Vol.1.Vol.1 disappoints. Its just the Book of Sorrow on printed page with a few extra illustrations. Don't get me wrong! I and many fans agree Book of Sorrow is the best "Lore" from Destiny 1's Grimoire page, but the fact that this is just the "book" on paper with a few sparse illustrations is a bummer.Vol.2 is a vast improvement, and I feel like you need the "full collection" if you're into Destiny lore in any way. Physically, the book is very well made with nice feeling paper, a sturdy spine, and a nice faux-leather pluffy cover. The few illustrations that are there are very well done. It'll look "classy" (or as classy as a piece of game merchandise can look) on a shelf.Just be aware what you're getting if you're a long-time fan. There's not alot new here.
